intro: Kalanchoe laxiflora, commonly known as the Cape Town Kalanchoe, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, upright stems and produces clusters of bright yellow flowers during the winter months. The leaves are thick and fleshy, adapted to store water in arid environments. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. This plant is also known for its resilience and ability to bloom reliably under proper care.
